author: Melisa Fluhr
text: 'We catered a luau themed outdoor party for 30ppl this summer using Shaka Bowl which is was located 40 minutes away from our home and we were thrilled! We went with build your own and asked for the serving dishes to be included. It was so simple to set an elegant buffet with loads of toppings and sauces. Everything arrived carefully packaged and right on time by a Shaka Bowl Manager. Our guest were then served dumplings and egg rolls passed along with big portions of tacos before making their own poke bowls. Again
column5: everything was fresh
column6: colorful and tasty. The next day
column7: the team came back to pick up their dishes and supplies. Big thanks to Kiersten and her team for the delicious food and for helping me host a such a memorable event!'

author: Gregory Gioia
text: 'Little pricey but great quality'

author: Barak Nizgoda
text: 'Love their Acai bowls

author: slug
text: 'Jesus is based af keep it going king'

author: Athos
text: "I had such high hopes for this bowl of poke. I live in the Heights by the Congress St. elevator
column5: and I have tried Tidal
column6: Pokay and Piki
column7: and each has its plusses and minuses
column8: and all can be very good - but Shaka Bowl was in walking distance to me
column9: so no driving and no expensive delivery fees either. I felt like I had just discovered something great! The first time I went there
column10: they had no salmon at all
column11: so I decided to wait for another time. That time was today. Easily the worst bowl of Poke I've had in the area
column12: by a looooong mile.\n\nI got a large bowl and asked to pay for an extra scoop of fish - and make the whole bowl half tuna and half salmon. I picked my toppings and ponzu sauce. I didn't see spicy mayo on the menu so I didn't ask. I got my order then decided to ask for some spicy mayo on the side
column13: figuring they must have it. The guy said it was not allowed. Turns out that sauce is called spicy shaka sauce
column15: but apparently you can only get one sauce with your bowl. Every other place is not this stingy - you can get a shoyu for your bowl and top it with spicy mayo everywhere else. Whatever
column16: I figured I'd go home and mix up some Kewpie mayo with some sriracha and mix it in to my bowl.\n\nI got home and did so
column17: but the portions were insulting. I asked for extra fish for the money
column18: and there was less fish on this bowl than any of the other three places I mentioned
column19: even if get a regular order
column20: let alone pay for extra. They were even stingy with the pineapple and edamame
column21: which there was little of compared to what I am used to
column22: and I couldn't taste a single sweet onion or cilantro. I tried to find them visually and I couldn't see them either. They forgot two of my toppings.\n\nEverything seemed fresh. But what's the point?"

author: Aeri Co
text: 'Ok
column5: so first of all I want to say I love this place for gf cookies and salmon bowl. But 15$ for regular fresh juice? I mean
column6: its beyond even Manhattan prices. 15$ for fresh juice which you pay normally for two of them.'

author: S Linn
text: "The food is great however the pricing is inconsistent every time I go. The menu says one thing

text:
'There‚Äôs such an amazing variety of options here! I love trying the various bowls available. They are delicious and thoughtfully made. I always add the coconut granola- it‚Äôs addictive.

My fianc√©e adores the breakfast bowl with the eggs and Buffalo sauce - we order from here often and it always comes promptly and perfectly packaged

Hot tip: the matcha shake is so delicious- keeps me full all day !'

text: 'It hurts me writing this review because the Madison Avenue location was my go to place when it first opened. On my last visit I ordered the Bannutry and what a disappointment it was. The bananas in this bowl were over ripen to the point there were slimy and not very please to eat. The shape of the container that this was all SQUISHED in did not make it any better. It was a one big mush by the time I got to the bottom of it - definitely not a good experience. I will try other options In town they offer this type of a bowl. Needless to say after 3 bites I threw it out in the trash. The bananas were simply not edible.'

text: "EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED took over 20 minutes to make my 2 overpriced bowls for $30... Now I say overpriced not because of price but because what I received for it . Absolutely pathetic. And as I asked what was taking so long
column5: the counter person had to clear their mouth of the wonton crisps they were so un elegantly shoving down their throat. 75 cents for avocado sure no prob .For a sliver that's 1/10th an avocado. Yeah that's nuts .fish the size of Penny's? Joke. Never gain will I come in here to throw away my money to these people. And on top of it all one of the two bowls was missing components.... NEVER AGAIN. BUYER BE WARE.If it was a regular restaurant and I hadn't paid with my card ahead of time I would have walked right out."

text: 'Shaka Bowl is great! Acai and poke bowls are extremely fresh

column6: Shaka shrunk their bowls to a noticeably smaller size. Prices remained the same for the smaller bowls. For that reason
column7: they get a 4 out of 5 from me.\nI still frequent Shaka

text: 'My first impression wasn‚Äôt very nice since while I was ordering
column5: the cashier was chewing chips or something and her mouth was so full that the pieces of food were falling out of it (all in front of me). Unpleasant
column6: unprofessional and disrespectful. Moreover
column7: after having a poke bowl from them for dinner
column8: I woke up in the middle of the night with a sharp pain in my stomach and had to take a medication. I was nearly vomiting. My friend who also ordered a bowl is still feeling awful. I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôll ever visit again.'

author: Diana Knight
text: 'I love this place.  Literally obsesssed.  I sometimes get both breakfast and dinner there.  I love food and I never feel the need to consider if it‚Äôs healthy.  The food here tastes amazing AND it‚Äôs fresh and tastes healthy.  I love the Poke bowls.  I think the size is good and I love the grilled chicken option.  I also love that you can mix rice with another base.  The zoodles are so good.  I also think the nutritious nanner bowl tastes like Nirvana.  The avocado toast with hot honey tastes like ‚ù§Ô∏è.  The bannutty pitaya Bowl is so fresh.\nI saw a couple of negative reviews about the staff and can only scratch my head.  I‚Äôve been there at least 50 times.  They‚Äôve been super nice to me and seemed to know what they were talking about.'

author: Sheila Taylor
text: 'The best things at this place (and the only things I have ever gotten) are the macaron ice cream sandwiches. The cookie is delightfully chewy
column5: which is a great contrast to the smooth
column6: flavorful ice cream. The flavors run a nice spectrum
column7: from the usual (rocky road) to the wacky (fruity pebbles!). Definitely give it a try (but prepared to wait in a long line)!'

text: 'Beautiful interior but who cares when the staff‚Äôs attitude doesn‚Äôt match. The acai was flavorless to the point where I actually had to keep tasting it to see if I just wasn‚Äôt getting a good bite
column5: but no it‚Äôs poor quality. Two stars for the fast service otherwise I‚Äôm sticking with my favorite local acai joint *rhymes with Schmaya Bowls*'

text: 'Me and my wife called because they say on their website dairy free. We were so excited to try dairy free bowls. We asked if the yogurt was dairy free they said it‚Äôs Greek yogurt. I said

text: "They changed the menu which is okay but now you have to build bowls a la carte instead of having pre made suggestions. They've also changed their bowls from recyclable brown cardboard bowls to plastic which is concerning. The bowls still taste good but there is a lot of filler rice and not much fish. They also charge the same price for their new small version of the bowls as they used to for the old full size."

author: N Gaston-McDonald
text: 'Traveled from the Bronx out to Hoboken (path train to light rail) because Nix (the birthday boy)  and I like poke

column8: so they were able to try something different. I had the zoodles in my poke
column9: Nix had zoodles and rice with ahi tuna. Everything was delicious and the service was good. The only reason not 5 stars is because we all wanted mango in our bowls
column10: but sadly no mango that day. Nix loved his smoothie afterwards and the coffee was delicious. We also took home monkey bread
column11: which my girls have tried to recreate
column12: because it was so tasty. Will definitely go back.'

text: 'I don‚Äôt know what happened to this place. It was awesome at the beginning

text: 'I have never had Poke before and am a bit skeptical of restaurants that promote themselves as healthy food
column5: but today I went to Shaka Bowl and it was one of the best meals I have ever had in my life. I have only been there once and plan to go back a lot

text: 'Really good poke

column7: and a couple mistakes were made with the order (mistakes happen). After emailing Shaka Bowl about the mistake
column8: they offered a free poke bowl on her next visit. They did not need to do that
column9: but really helped make sure we go back.'

text: 'For the slight premium this place has decent healthy food options. I usually order build your own bowl with seafood protein
column5: rice

column7: I personally highly recommend the smoothies. Plenty of healthy

author: Outlet Home Inspections
text: "I have been here a couple of times. I love the new Acai and poke bowl movement. They are absolutely delicious and best of all you do not have to feel bad for eating one. I like the cacao Nutella Acai bowl; it's super filling and a nice power breakfast/lunch. The Acai Bowls will run you 10$.\n\nI also enjoy the Poke Bowls
column5: I usually just build my own. You can mix and match greens with a base and general protein. Add some sweet and spicy sauce to give it a nice kick. Poke Bowls are a bit more expensive running you 14$.\n\nEven though this place is a bit expensive it is still much cheaper then NYC spots. Good luck with parking in the area. Also it is a small seating area. They need to expand to Jersey City."
